ğŸ’¡ å­¸ç¿’å°è²¼å£« Learning Tips

  • aa vs a: "aa" is longer and more open, like "father". "a" is shorter.
  • o vs u: "o" is like "caught", "u" is like "food".
  • -ng endings: The sound comes from the back of your throat.
  • -k, -t, -p endings: These are "stopped" sounds - don't release the final consonant!
  • Practice by listening to minimal pairs (words that differ by only one sound).
